body:
Comment 1: 
If Unix shells worked differently, then this approach would
work well; but they don't, so it doesn't.

I don't understand the context where this arises.  You should
tell 'go get' what you want to install, and it will install it.
It will not install extra commands.  For example, if I run

    go get code.google.com/p/codesearch/cmd/{cindex,csearch}

it does not also install codesearch/cmd/cgrep.
_Status changed to **WaitingForReply**._
